skillTree.localised_description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
The hatred and fear Sayl garners from his own kin is something respected, admired, and heeded by the greater tribes.

effects.description:
Attribute: Perfect Vigour for Kurgan Horsemen units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 15% for Kurgan Horsemen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These abominations' master has honed their murder-lust as carefully as he has excised their awareness of himself as a possible target of their wrath.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +15 for Curs'd Ettin units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +15 for Curs'd Ettin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When Sayl has closed other avenues of servitude or rebellion, all that is left is to serve him to the bitter end he has chosen for you.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not until the most opportune moment that Sayl reveals to his enemies that their occult power was in fact in his hands all along.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -10
	(enemy armies in local province)

Spell resistance: -20%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: What eldritch power Sayl's Chaos-maddened senses can glimpse, they can sometimes grasp, and make it his.
Though it was magic that disfigured Sayl so terribly, he has since learned better.
A much more controlled manifestation of the raw power unleashed when Sayl created the Nightmaw. Now his Sorcerers can benefit from it, barring any accidents of his choosing.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +10
	(all armies factionwide)

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The skull in Sayl's right hand is no mere ornament. It is a reminder. Sometimes raising the skull in warning is more effective than raising his staff in anger.
Sayl follows no path but his own. The ebb and flow of the Winds are his causeways.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Lore of Shadows and Lore of Heavens Magic
Cooldown: -20% for Lore of Shadows and Lore of Heavens spells

skillTree.localised_description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Wind Blast"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Wind Blast Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wind Blast Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Urannon's Thunderbolt"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Urannon's Thunderbolt Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Urannon's Thunderbolt Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Chain Lightning"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
A Chaos Lord dominates  lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

Melee attack: +4 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, Marauder Bearmen and Marauder Champions units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +3% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Marauder Chariot and Kurgan Horsemen units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Marauder Chariot and Kurgan Horsemen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Skin Wolves and Troll units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky  its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Manticore, Chimera and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Manticore, Chimera and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Manticore, Chimera and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Giant, deadly, and able to take orders, this Lords monstrosities are especially terrifying and lethal.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, Dread Maw, Curs'd Ettin and War Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, Dread Maw, Curs'd Ettin and War Mammoth units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

Armour: +12 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, Marauder Bearmen and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

Missile strength: +8% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, Marauder Chariot and Kurgan Horsemen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, Marauder Chariot and Kurgan Horsemen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, Marauder Chariot and Kurgan Horsemen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth, Chimera, Dread Maw, Curs'd Ettin and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth, Chimera, Dread Maw, Curs'd Ettin and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth, Chimera, Dread Maw, Curs'd Ettin and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.

effects.description:
Income and Spoils from pillaging settlements: +3%
	(Lord's army)

Income and Spoils from pillaging settlements: +6%
	(Lord's army)

Income and Spoils from pillaging settlements: +9%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
Mists sometimes feel as if they have a will of their own, a presence meant to trick and thwart those lost within them. Sometimes, that will is, in fact, someone else's

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Fimir Nobles
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +4%

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

factionEffects.localised_description: Sayl the Faithless, Twisted Seer of the Wastes. A cunning and treacherous sorcerer, and the ruler of the Dolgan tribe, who rose to power through manipulation, betrayal, and arcane mastery.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +24 for Champions from Allegiance to the Gods
Recruit rank: +24 for Champions from Allegiance to the Gods
Enact Manipulations to undermine others, affecting their settlements, armies, or their entire faction - or strengthen your own forces.

Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
	(all armies)
Lord and Hero recruit rank: +3 for Shaman-Sorcerers

	(all armies)

Weapon strength: +10% for Kurgan Horsemen units
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: Entwined with gnashing serpents, every swing of this foul Dolgan heirloom sees venom ooze from snapping fangs.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 for Kurgan Horsemen units
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: This corpse-skin bag contains the sigil-etched teeth of Sayls former master Schalkain and other defeated wizards and magical beasts, each a treacherous curse to hurl at his enemies.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +25%
	(local province)

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Though blind, his otherworldly sight shows him the way. Though only human, neither mortal nor immortal can escape his traps."

effects.description:
Enables poison attacks for Kurgan Horsemen units
	(Lord's army)
